data.title: Removed unnecessary check from Serializable::SaveJSON, closes #1265
Type mismatch in vehicle sample code
SQLCompleteAsync not found in odbc32.dll on Win 7 64 bit SP1
data.body:
we can fix it by add micro in nanodbc.cpp  

```
#ifdef _WIN32
    // needs to be included above sql.h for windows
    #define NOMINMAX
    #include <windows.h>
#endif

#define ODBCVER 0x0351
#define SQL_OV_ODBC3_80 3UL

#include <sql.h>
#include <sqlext.h>
```

FYI
https://github.com/lexicalunit/nanodbc/issues/56

data.title: Play subset frames of an animation
data.body:
Is there anyway to play a few frames of an animation but not the whole frames? 
Or I need to export a lot of animation files?

For now, I only export all animations in one .ani file with a long frame counts, I'd like to play frame 0 -> 20  as a walking animation, frame 21-50 as skill1 animation. how can I do this?

And I found that an animationState keeps a copy of animation tracks, is it necessary to keep them for every animationState? Why not just get them from the resourceCache?

data.title: Convenience method Context::CreateObject<T>()
data.body:
So we can create objects like:

```
context_->CreateObject<MyType>()
```

Just like creating components.

data.title: Serializable::SaveJSON dest.IsNull()
data.body:
I'm not sure if `if (dest.IsNull())` check is necessary in `bool Serializable::SaveJSON(JSONValue& dest) const`. It could be copied from SaveXML method by mistake. One has to assign a dummy object to the JSONFile root in order to use SaveJSON() method, because it returns false otherwise.
Also possibly code could be changed so that JSONFile acts more similarly to XMLFile, allowing to set the default node name.

data.title: DebugHud/Profiler average and frame values are weird
data.body:
Something is wrong with the average and the frame values.
The frame value is always the same as average:  
![](http://i.imgur.com/Xautuy0.jpg)  
What is it supposed to display?
I'm optimizing a function and at first it looked like optimizing that function made other functions slower.
This is the normal version of ClearImage (Image::Clear): [http://i.imgur.com/Xautuy0.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/Xautuy0.jpg)
And this my optimized one: [http://i.imgur.com/rhRPt0m.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/rhRPt0m.jpg)
It looks like the optimization made SetTextureData (directly above ClearImage) much slower, which can't be. I'm just setting the bytes a bit differently. Also tried that outside Clear() and by measuring with my own timer, only the clearing gets much faster and SetTextureData does not change on a per call basis.

[Gif illustrating the issue](https://i.gyazo.com/f7cd1861b29e1649d5466fc90cdd4695.gif)

I believe that issue was introduced somewhere after 451f713a19ea654556c6cfd794be0b81016f5998, probably SDL update.

data.title: For AppVeyor - address the issue of "choco install doxygen graphviz" frequently timeout
data.body:
Here are the discussion with AppVeyor support regarding this issue.

> Thanks for your prompt reply. I am a Linux user and has been spoiled with yum/dnf/apt package managers which can automatically use the nearest mirror based on GeoIP. From what you have described it appears that choco still has long way to go. Anyway, is it too much to ask to have some of their commonly used packages to be hosted locally by AppVeyor in such a way that it is transparent to user, i.e. the script still uses `choco install whatever` as per usual? If that is not possible then we have to think of other ways on our side. Having a binary build artifact in one of our source code repository would be last resort.
> 
> Best regards,
> YaoWT
> 
> > On Fri, Mar 18, 2016 at 6:39 AM, Feodor Fitsner feodor@appveyor.com wrote:
> > That's absolutely possible there could be networking issue of any sort. For instance, if you look at install.ps1 script for doxygen: https://chocolatey.org/packages/doxygen.portable - you'll see it's pulling a zip from the server located in Netherlands. It should be "OK" when the server is located overseas, however there could be increased latency or varying connection speed between AppVeyor VMs (Central US) and those servers. I even remember the case when a library was being downloaded from a server under .edu domain and after X successful downloads it started throwing something like "your IP has been blocked because of high download activity".
> > 
> > Both doxygen and graphviz are "portable" libraries meaning there are just .zip archives without installers. You can re-pack them and place either to your repo or to some "closer" and more reliably location like Azure blob storage, Amazon S3 or Google storage.
> > 
> > -Feodor Fitsner, AppVeyor
> > 
> > > On Wed, Mar 16, 2016 at 10:36 PM, Wei Tjong Yao weitjong@gmail.com wrote:
> > > The installation process returned with non-zero exit code. I don't have a way to actually log the error message and measure the time that it took before returning the non-zero exit code. But my guess is, it was network error and the process got time-out. You see, we actually do a very tight while-loop to keep reinstalling until the exit code is zero (success). In each iteration we echo out a status line stating "installing .....". The number of status lines message in the build job should be huge if the while-loop iterates in fast rate, since this is not the case so I guess this was what has happened. I am sorry that this is what I can provide right now. Thanks for your time in looking into this issue.
> > > 
> > > Best regards,
> > > YaoWT
> > > 
> > > > On Wed, Mar 16, 2016 at 11:25 PM, Feodor Fitsner feodor@appveyor.com wrote:
> > > > Hi Yao,
> > > > 
> > > > What errors do you get while installing those choco packages?
> > > > 
> > > > -Feodor Fitsner, AppVeyor
> > > > 
> > > > > On Wed, Mar 16, 2016 at 6:46 AM, Wei Tjong Yao weitjong@gmail.com wrote:
> > > > > Hi,
> > > > > 
> > > > > Please see the following build log. https://ci.appveyor.com/project/weitjong/urho3d/build/608
> > > > > The first job installed doxygen and graphviz successfully at first try, while the second job keep failing. We have used a brute force logic in our script to keep installing until it succeed. Although this works, the time it takes to just get ready is too long. This did not happen just once or twice in the past. So, why it needs multiple attempt to get the software installed? Do we something wrong here? I believe doxygen + graphviz installation requirement should be quite common.
> > > > > 
> > > > > Best regards,
> > > > > YaoWT

data.title: Building issues persist on MinGW-w64 with D3D9 and D3D11
data.body:
Updated to the latest to get weitjong's commit to fix the MinGW build, but still having problems.

CMake Error at CMake/Modules/FindDirectX.cmake:83 (message):
  Could not find MinGW system root.  Use MINGW_SYSROOT environment variable
  or build option to specify the location of system root.

Specifying MINGW_SYSROOT manually on the command line as C:/mingw64, configuration proceeds as expected until I end up with the exact same errors as noted in issue #1247  with D3D not found:

CMake Error at C:/Program Files (x86)/CMake/share/cmake-3.5/Modules/FindPackageHandleStandardArgs.cmake:148 (message):
  Could NOT find DirectX using MinGW default search paths (missing: D3D)

I am invoking the build process as:

cmake_mingw Build -DURHO3D_64BIT=1 -DURHO3D_LUAJIT=1 -DURHO_3DOPENGL=0 -DMINGW_SYSROOT=c:/mingw64

When building with -DURHO_3DOPENGL=1 for a GL build, the process succeeds. Embedded in the output text scroll is the line:

-- Found DirectX: TRUE  found components:  DInput DSound XInput missing components:  XAudio2

So clearly it's finding SOME of DirectX, even if it can't find D3D.

I'm not very skilled at the CMake build system, so I'm not sure what I can do to help track this down. But if you need any further information from me, let me know. In the meantime, I've rolled back some commits and am continuing to use the older version of Urho for work on my game.

data.title: Applied patch to fix undefined reference error when compiling for Wayland on Linux.
data.body:
Applied patch to fix undefined reference error when compiling for Wayland (1.10) on Linux.

This has been fixed in SDL, but no SDL release has been made that includes this fix.

The SDL fix can be found here:
https://hg.libsdl.org/SDL/rev/330f500d5815

In the mean time, this fixes Urho3D compilation on Linux.

data.title: CMake minor Error: DIRECTX_INCLUDE_DIRS notfound; mingw-w64; workaround
data.body:
cmake output:

```
[... found DirectX headers, found Urho3D target, found Doxygen]
CMake Error: The following variables are used in this project, but they are set to NOTFOUND.
Please set them or make sure they are set and tested correctly in the CMake files:
DIRECTX_INCLUDE_DIRS (ADVANCED)
   used as include directory in directory urho
   used as include directory in directory urho/Source [...]
```

example cmake input:
`cmake -G "MinGW Makefiles" -D CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Debug -D CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS="-march=native" -D URHO3D_64BIT=1 -D URHO3D_ANGELSCRIPT=1 -D URHO3D_DOCS_QUIET=0 -D DOXYGEN_SKIP_DOT=1 -D URHO3D_LIB_TYPE=SHARED -D URHO3D_MKLINK=1 -D URHO3D_OPENGL=1 -D URHO3D_SAMPLES=0 -D URHO3D_URHO2D=0 -D URHO3D_LOGGING=1 -D URHO3D_TOOLS=0 "%SOURCE%"`

Workaround:
Define the value for cmake. I tried empty and default mingw-w64 headers are still found:
`cmake -G "MinGW Makefiles" -D DIRECTX_INCLUDE_DIRS=""`

data.title: Stop specific sound types
data.body:
Urho can use the sound type system to stop specific sounds, instead of all sounds or manually selected sounds.
Use case: When opening a menu and the game pauses, pause in-game sound effects only, while still allowing music and UI sound effects.
Note it's important to pause and not mute, so if the game was stopped while playing a sound that sound will resume.

Possible approach:
Either replace `Audio::masterGain_` with a general sound type map (`Audio::soundTypes_`), or make a new map for stop sound types if there's any reason not to have a single map.

Functions:

``` C++
Audio::Stop(const String& type);
Audio::Play(const String& type);
```

Could work like `Audio::SetMasterGain()`, iterating over the sound sources and updating them.

data.title: Spec EnvCube
data.body:
Env Cube is reflection of environment, so it should use specular map

```
#ifdef ENVCUBEMAP
    finalColor += cMatEnvMapColor * textureCube(sEnvCubeMap, reflect(vReflectionVec, normal)).rgb * specColor;
#endif
```

Also it allow to simulate metallic parts of model

![metal](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13021826/13779014/636e77b2-ead2-11e5-9774-fc95a23193a2.png)

data.title: UITemplate
IntRect design issue
data.body: IntRect seems to return Height() as a negative number, it seems to be doing bottom_-top_ instead of what would be logical.  As these are ambiguous names anyway, why doesn't IntRect follow Rect where it has containing min_ and max_'s, so instead of doing myIntRect.bottom_=42 we would do myIntRect.min_.y=42 as that is unambiguous of which side should have the lower number.  Currently bottom_ has to have the higher number than what is in top_, which is backwards from the naming convention...
